column4: sigh, I'm still dealing with this GNOME consistant hdd writing problem... anyone wanna lend me a hand?
It seems that every 3 or 4 seconds, (like clockwork) about 25k or so is writen to my drive... but only when I'm logged into Gnome.
I've found others with the same problem... http://www.fedoraforum.org/forum/showthread.php?t=24472
maybe its FAM?
what does fam do?
file alteration monitor, part of GNOME
and what will happen if i kill it's process?
other programs will become unaware of other program's file changes.
and fam could be writing to the disk? I don't think I'd want to lose that feature...
I vaguely recall that as being the explaination.
I've read about this problem around the net, but it does not seem to be widespread. I've only seen it on my home computer (the one I'm on now)...
nope.. killing famd did not stop it.
but thanks, that's the best help I've been able to find in the past two days. . .sigh.
ok, good luck
Well you are using ubuntu and gnome right?
yup
Ubuntu warty
Is your disk activity light flashing slightly every few seconds on the dot?
yes
(ubuntu, warty here too)
and this does not worry you?
I figure the computer knows what it's doing. ;-)
